If you can get past the steep learning curve this is a fun, horror experience that rewards skill and critical thinking on both sides. In recent months, dedicated servers for the game have made things worse for some players in terms of latency, but if the devs improve these servers and continue to focus on balancing their game will be in a great place.

Bonjour pour commencer je dirai "L'amitié double les joies et réduit de moitié les peines." fameuse et extraordinaire citation de Francis BACON.  La réunification de ma personne à mes amis sur ce jeu, m'a fait prendre conscience que Francis avait raison. Ouai en gros petit monopoly très sympa quand on a des amis.

"Lots of fun winning or losing. Tense game of Cat and mouse. One of the best multiplayer games out there that isn't a dudebro shooter." - My initial review of Dead by Daylight at just over 5hrs of gameplay

Updated Review after 250+ hrs more:

Dead by Daylight is a bittersweet game. It lures you in with either playing as a killer hunting a team of survivors before they can escape or try to survive as you struggle in a tense game of cat and mouse.

And for the first couple of weeks, it makes good on this promise. Eventually you start getting better at the game and you rank up and then you notice the game changes. It goes from what it promises to a different beast entirely and honestly not for the better.

I have hit Red Ranks with Both survivor and killer and one thing I will commend the developers on is both experiences are vastly different. As a Survivor, I can have my headphones on, play some music in the background, relax and generally have a good time. Where as with the killer - even in games where I get 4 kills - I feel stressed, tired and like I have achieved nothing.

The problem with the game is that it is always in a flux of balance problems but that balance is always weighted towards survivors. Survivor game play is actively rewarded for making mistakes - which seems the opposite of what it should be. The issue lies with in the power of the perks they are given. When you first start the game it teaches you (in a very,very basic tutorial) that survivors go down in 2 hits and then you hook them - 3 hooks and that survivor is out. However - the reality is sometimes it can take 3-5 hits to down a survivor and even then getting them to a hook is not even guaranteed.

Survivor "mains" however will complain about killer perks that Allow you to instantly down them (allowing for a hook) or any sort of power shift to the killer. See Dead by Daylight's biggest farce - is that Killers are stronger than what they are. Any killer that can out mind game a survivor (Spirit, Nurse) tend to be the focus of both the developers and the community outcry and are nerfed. Even the "fun and balanced" killers in the eyes of both the Developer's and Community - Nerfed.

Meanwhile as a Killer you will have to deal with all this plus - Toxicity, Game Stalling, Teabagging, Survivors playing with friends over comms using perks that straight render some killers useless, Survivors body blocking,  Multiple generators being completed even after the shortest of chases and that is just the tip of the iceberg.

Unfortunately with the 4th anniversary patch - the game has become far less fun, especially in my eyes. I have tried coming back with every new patch and recently even tried the new killer Blight - who wasn't for me and everytime I play I end up being reminded why I stopped in the first place.

I expect this review will more than likely get hit by alot of negativity due to Survivor mains thinking that Killer mains just want to 1 shot everyone and 4k every game - This is not true for me, I just would like to have a fun and enjoyable experience like I do when I play survivor, as Killer, because being a killer is what attracted me to the game in the first place.

After 250+ hours, Watching many of Otzdarva, Umbra, Monto, ScottJund and True Talent's steams, videos, guides and getting to the Red Ranks of Killer and Survivor, I can honestly say this is the first game where the higher I climbed, the less I wanted to play. And that is sad, because this game should be the game I love as it has all my favourite Horror killers in it and the killers mechanically are fun to play - it's just after hours of dealing with God Loops, SWFs, Survivors running the same meta perks, Ormond, Toxicity, Bloodwebs not giving perks I need, etc... It has just worn me down.

I still support and hold a glimmer of hope that this game will one day reignite the fire and passion in me it had when I first started - but as for now I've accepted the fact that given I have bought the game and all DLC on PC and switch and played for nearly 60 hrs on my switch and 250+ on PC - I got my value for money out of it.

So if you made it this far - I still recommend Dead by Daylight as everyone's experience might be different - this is just where I am at with the game at this time of writing and should that opinion change - I will update my review accordingly.

まず始めたばかりの時は分単位のマッチングの長さが鬱陶しい。その長いマッチングを突破したらエラーするかどうかの運ゲー（体感33％）が始まる。運ゲーに負けると強制終了からの再起動で、特定のいくつかのアイテムが無に吸われる。

   次に試合の時、慣れない頃は煽られ、慣れてきても煽られ、うまくなって最高ランクになっても煽られる。所謂ファンメ的な何かが試合後にすぐ飛んでくることはよ～くあること。続けていくうちにメンタルが強くなるか麻痺っていくか。

   肝心のゲームバランスだけど、運営が常にサバイバー優先になるようにどんどんアプデしていってる。これから更にサバ優先となるアプデが既に確定している。キラーはボランティアだってそこそこ有名な配信者含め、色々な方が言っている。どういう意味かは察してくれ。

   これらの要素を楽しめられる人らであればぜひ買ってみてくれ。きっと末永くサービス停止まで楽しめられるのだろう。
